word: The service was held on the lawn in front of Mrs. White's quiet country home, which had long been to her a haven of rest,-- a veritable "refuge," as she often styled it when returning from public labors. At one end of the lawn had been erected a canopy for the officiating ministers; while chairs and benches conveniently placed beneath the wide-spreading elms, with sofas and rockers for the aged and the infirm, gave seats for all who came.
